column4: Is there an easy way to make my desktop look better on a non-flatscreen tv monitor?
define "better"
Everything is hard to read and stuff
ahh.. tried to bring screen resolution down?
Did that, but its still hard to use.
Q&D way is to drop close enough to PAL (or whatever it happens to be) reso
you can also tune DPO
s/DPO/DPI
i dont know how to do that.
Lasterline: sometimes your motherboard bios messes stuff up. Try making the bios use linux and not itself or whatever.
i've got "DisplaySize     398 297" on the Section "Monitor" in /etc/X11/XF86Config-4
is that what I need to change mine to?
that sets the physical size of your monitor
oh
what is that measured in?
not really have to, but it helps you to tune font sizes and stuff
millimetres
after setting that if you select a font to be 14pt it really _is_ 14pt on your screen
TTilus; How do I change font size?
font preferences, it's on system -> settings -> ...
ok
or something like that, i've got this thingie in finnish, so i'm not exactly sure about the translations
